page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY IN GODMERSHAM
page.content: Godmersham (Godmer's Ham or settlement 966 AD) is still a small settlement, with one of the farms, Trimworth, mentioned in the first Domesday book still inhabited and with a similair acreage. Godmersham Park is famous for its connection with the novelist Jane Austen 1775-1817 who found inspiration for some of her novels while staying there with her brother who owned the mansion. Other points of interest include the old bridge over the river Stour, originally a saddleback,built by the parish in 1698, and the New Barn one of the largest tythe barns in Kent. It belonged to Court Lodge a 13C house of great ecclesiastical interest sadly demolished in 1955. It is at present being excavated.
